titles.title: Zena nägäromu lä-śǝllase “Story of the Trinity” / Täʾamrihomu lä-ʾab wä-wäld wä-mänfäs qǝddus “Miracles of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit” / Mälkǝʾa śǝllase “Image of the Trinity”

shortcontents.shortcontent: I) Zena nägäromu lä-śǝllase “Story of the Trinity” (fols. 5ra-53ra) I-1) Introductory homily (fols. 5ra-12ra) I-2) Homily for the month of Miyazya (fols. 12ra-12vb) I-3) Homily for the month of Gǝnbot (fols. 13ra-14ra) I-4) Homily for the month of Säne (fols. 14ra-15va) I-5) Homily for the month of Ḥamle (fols. 15va-24vb) I-6) Homily for the month of Näḥase (fols. 24vb-26rb) I-7) Homily for the month of Ṗagwǝmen (fols. 26rb-27vb) I-8) Homily for the month of Mäskäräm (fols. 27vb-31vb) I-9) Homily for the month of Ṭǝqǝmt (fols. 31vb-32vb) I-10) Homily for the month of Ḫǝdar (fols. 32vb-34ra) I-11) Homily for the month of Taḫśaś (fols. 34ra-34vb) I-12) Homily for the month of Ṭǝrr (fols. 34vb-36vb) I-13) Homily for the month of Yäkkatit (fols. 36vb-38rb) I-15) Dǝrsan zä-ʿaśǝrtu-wä-kǝlʾǝtu ʾawraḫ “Homily for the 12 months” (fols. 38rb-53rb) II) Täʾamrihomu lä-ʾab wä-wäld wä-mänfäs qǝddus “Miracles of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit”: 62 miracles (fols. 53ra-115rb) III) Mälkǝʾa śǝllase “Image of the Trinity” (fols. 115rb-118vb) (ChRep 191, no. 20).

owners.owner: Several names are mentioned in the supplication formulas: Gäbrä Maryam (fols. 4v, 14ra, 15va, 23vb, 26rb, 115rb), Wälättä Mikaʾel (fols. 4v, 12vb, 36vb, 106ra, 115rb), Wälättä Yohannǝs (fols. 4v, 111ra, 115rb), Ḫaylä Śǝllase (fols. 4v, 107ra, 113rb, 115rb).

txstates.txstate: The leather cover is slightly damaged on the edges. Some fols. are dirty and very dirty, e.g., 29v, 30r, 30v, 31r, 33r, 33v, 34r. Fol. 20, of smaller size and an excerpt from a different hand (but written in the same hand) might originate from another Ms. The red ink is faded off on most fols. The parchment quality on fol. 96v is poor, column b left empty.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered in reddish-brown tooled leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornaments on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 5 tools were used: triple line fillet, cross hatching, double circle, x-form, small x).

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.

squires.squire:
A(4/fols. 1r-4v) – I(8/fols. 5r-12v) – ፪II(8+1; {s.l.: 8, stub before 8}/fols.13r-21v) – ፫III(8/fols. 22r-29v) – IV(8/fols. 30r-37v) – V(6/fols. 38r-43v) – VI(6/fols. 44r-49v) – VII(8/fols. 50r-57v) – VIII(6/fols. 58r-63v) – IX(6/fols. 64r-69v) – X(9; s.l.: 8, stub after 1/fols. 70r-78v) – XI(8/fols. 79r-86v) – XII(8/fols. 87r-94v) – XIII(7; s.l.: 2, stub after 6/fols. 95r-101v) – XIV(10; s.l.: 3, stub after 8; 7, stub after 4/fols. 102r-111v) – XV(9; s.l.: 6, stub after 3/ fols. 112r-120v).
Fol. 20 originates from a different manuscript.

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; names of the donor; doxology (also with alternating red and black letters, e.g., fols. 24ra, 24vb, 25rb, 26ra, 27ra); groups of lines alternating with black lines on the incipit page of Texts I, II; two lines alternating with black lines in the incipit of Text III; groups of lines alternating with black lines in the incipit of each subsection in Text I; incipit of each subsection in Text II; the word sälam; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

otherdetails.otherdetail: The miracles in Text II are not numbered.

extras.extra: - Fol. 20 might originate from another Ms., it contains an unidentified Marian prayer (but written in the main hand). - Tämälläs-sign in the shape of a cross indicating the place where the omissions, written in the margins, belong: fol. 28vb, 29va, 116ra, 117ra. - Minor notes and scribbles: fols. 2r, 4r, 36v, 119v, 120r, 120v.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: - Undecorated quire marks are written in the upper left corner: Fols. 13r, 22r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid:
- Monthly readings are indicated by the names of the months or written in the upper margin, in the main hand, in red or in black, in frames of black lines or red dots: ዘሚዝያ [sic]: fol. 12r ዘሰኔ: fol. 14r ዘሐምሌ: fol. 15v ነሐሴ: fol. 24v ጳጉሜን: fol. 26r መስከረም: fol. 27v ዘጥቅምት: fol. 31v ወርኃ፡ ኅዳር : fol. 32v ታሕሣሥ: fol. 34r ዘጥር: fol. 35r ዘመጋቢት: fol. 37r (secondary hand) ዘይትነበብ፡ በ፲ወ፪አውራኅ፡: fol.39r ዘሚያዝያ: fol. 57v ዘሐምሌ: fol. 77r ታሕሣሥ: fol. 99r ጥር: fol. 105r የካቲት: fol. 109v
- Indications written in a crude recent hand: የካቲት: fols. 36v, 109v ዘግንቦት: fols. 65v ዘሐምሌ: fol. 75v ታህሣስ: fol. 109r

frames.frame: Fol. 5r (incipit of Text I): elaborate coloured (green, yellow, red, black) ornamental band with central pendant reaching the bottom of the text; interlaces, geometric motifs. Fol. 53r (incipit of Text II): elaborate coloured (green, yellow, red, black) ornamental band; interlaces, geometric motifs. Fol. 115r (incipit of Text III): elaborate coloured (green, yellow, red, black) ornamental band; interlaces, geometric motifs.
